intro: Couthovia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs characterized by their alternate leaves and often fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fruit that resembles a star shape, hence its common name. Its botanical features include compound leaves with three to five leaflets and a distinctive, aromatic resinous sap. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
